Class Map.Map

java.lang.Object
Map.Map
public class Map.Map
extends java.lang.Object
class that builds the map and executes the commands from the input file vertexes - number of nodes adjacencyList - the map represented as a oriented graph with adjacency list pq - priority queue used for Dijkstra dist - minimum distance array

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Map.Map​(int vertexes)
    constructor for Map.Map object

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addRestriction​(java.lang.String type, int source, int dest, int cost)
    adds a additional cost to the street
    void addStreet​(int source, int dest, int cost, int gauge)
    adds a street to the map with its cost and maximum gauge
    void drive​(Vehicle.Vehicle v, int source, int dest)
    this method implements drive method, which is, in essence, Dijkstra's algorithm implementation; initialise the minimum distance array with the maximum integer value for every vertex, except the source node which is 0; adds the source node to the priority queue and the parent of him to -1 to know the end when the path is printed; elements are extracted from the priority queue until it is empty or until all the nodes have been extracted from it if the priority queue is empty and not all the nodes have been extracted then if the destination node was extracted then a path to the destination node was found, else if the destination was not extracted a path from source to destination does not exist;
    int getDestIndex​(java.util.ArrayList<Map.Street> streets, int dest)
    seeks for the index of the destination node
    int[] getDist()
    getter for dist array
    int getVertexes()
    getter for Vertexes
    void neighbours​(int u, Vehicle.Vehicle v, int[] parent, java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> settled)
    this function will process all the neighbours of extracted vertex u and will update the minimum distance array if the new distance is less than the actual distance, also updates tbe parent of the node and if is not settled add it to the priority queue
    void printDijkstra​(int[] parent, int dest)
    method that prints the path from source to dest, if it exists, and the minimum distance
    void printPath​(int destination, int[] parent)
    prints the shortest path from source to destination with the help of recursion goes back until the source node is found and then exits the recursion and prints the path from the source node
    void setDist​(int[] dist)
    setter for dist array
    void setVertexes​(int vertexes)
    setter for vertexes

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Map.Map

      public Map.Map​(int vertexes)
      constructor for Map.Map object
      Parameters:
      vertexes - number of nodes

  • Method Details

    • addStreet

      public void addStreet​(int source, int dest, int cost, int gauge)
      adds a street to the map with its cost and maximum gauge
      Parameters:
      source - the point where the new street starts
      dest - the point where the new street ends
      cost - the cost of the street
      gauge - the maximum gauge for the street

    • getDestIndex

      public int getDestIndex​(java.util.ArrayList<Map.Street> streets, int dest)
      seeks for the index of the destination node
      Parameters:
      streets - list of streets where the program will seek for destination
      dest - the value of destination node
      Returns:
      returns the index of destination node if found, else returns -1

    • drive

      public void drive​(Vehicle.Vehicle v, int source, int dest)
      this method implements drive method, which is, in essence, Dijkstra's algorithm implementation; initialise the minimum distance array with the maximum integer value for every vertex, except the source node which is 0; adds the source node to the priority queue and the parent of him to -1 to know the end when the path is printed; elements are extracted from the priority queue until it is empty or until all the nodes have been extracted from it if the priority queue is empty and not all the nodes have been extracted then if the destination node was extracted then a path to the destination node was found, else if the destination was not extracted a path from source to destination does not exist;
      Parameters:
      v - the vehicle that is driven on the streets from source to dest
      source - the point where the vehicle starts to drive
      dest - the point where the vehicle should arrive

    • neighbours

      public void neighbours​(int u, Vehicle.Vehicle v, int[] parent, java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> settled)
      this function will process all the neighbours of extracted vertex u and will update the minimum distance array if the new distance is less than the actual distance, also updates tbe parent of the node and if is not settled add it to the priority queue
      Parameters:
      u - the minimum distance node that is removed from the priority queue
      v - the vehicle that is driven on the streets
      parent - the array that saves the parents of the vertexes
      settled - set that saves the extracted nodes from the priority queue

    • printDijkstra

      public void printDijkstra​(int[] parent, int dest)
      method that prints the path from source to dest, if it exists, and the minimum distance
      Parameters:
      parent - array which saves the parent of each vertex
      dest - destination node

    • printPath

      public void printPath​(int destination, int[] parent)
      prints the shortest path from source to destination with the help of recursion goes back until the source node is found and then exits the recursion and prints the path from the source node
      Parameters:
      destination - destination node
      parent - array which saves the parent of each vertex

    • addRestriction

      public void addRestriction​(java.lang.String type, int source, int dest, int cost)
      adds a additional cost to the street
      Parameters:
      type - the type of the restriction
      source - the starting point of the street
      dest - the ending point of the street
      cost - the additional cost

    • getVertexes

      public int getVertexes()
      getter for Vertexes
      Returns:
      number of vertexes

    • setVertexes

      public void setVertexes​(int vertexes)
      setter for vertexes
      Parameters:
      vertexes - new value of vertexes

    • getDist

      public int[] getDist()
      getter for dist array
      Returns:
      minimum distance array

    • setDist

      public void setDist​(int[] dist)
      setter for dist array
      Parameters:
      dist - new value for dist
